slides.title: Node.js
slides.subtitle:
Server-side JavaScript Runtime
Building Scalable Backend Applications

box.content: JavaScript runtime built on Chrome's V8 JavaScript engine

list.text: Server-side JavaScript - Run JS outside the browser

note.text: Fun fact: Node.js was created by Ryan Dahl in 2009 and now powers companies like Netflix, Uber, PayPal, and LinkedIn!

list.text: JavaScript Engine - Compiles JS to machine code
Google Chrome - Same engine as Chrome browser

Key Components:
â€¢ V8 Engine - JavaScript execution
â€¢ Event Loop - Single thread, event-driven
â€¢ libuv - C library for async I/O
â€¢ Thread Pool - Handles heavy operations
â€¢ OS Async Helpers - File system, network

list.text: Single Thread - One main thread for JavaScript
Non-blocking I/O - Async operations don't block thread
Perfect for I/O - APIs, databases, file operations
Python - Great for data science, ML, scripting

box.code:
# Using Node Version Manager (nvm) - Recommended
curl -o- https://raw.githubusercontent.com/nvm-sh/nvm/v0.39.0/install.sh | bash

# Install latest LTS version
nvm install --lts
nvm use --lts

# Direct download from nodejs.org
# Visit https://nodejs.org and download installer

# Using package managers
# Ubuntu/Debian
curl -fsSL https://deb.nodesource.com/setup_lts.x | sudo -E bash -
sudo apt-get install -y nodejs

# macOS with Homebrew
brew install node

# Check installation
node --version
npm --version

# Update npm
npm install -g npm@latest

# Start REPL
node

# In REPL, you can:
> 2 + 2
4

> const name = 'John'
undefined

> console.log(`Hello ${name}`)
Hello John
undefined

> .help  # Show available commands

> .exit  # Exit REPL

# Running JavaScript files
node app.js

# Run with environment variables
NODE_ENV=production node app.js

# Debug mode
node --inspect app.js

list.text: npm - Default, largest registry, good for beginners

box.code:
# npm
npm init                    # Create package.json
npm install express         # Install package
npm install -g nodemon      # Install globally
npm update                  # Update packages
npm run script-name         # Run script

# yarn
yarn init                   # Create package.json
yarn add express            # Install package
yarn global add nodemon     # Install globally
yarn upgrade                # Update packages
yarn script-name            # Run script

# pnpm
pnpm init                   # Create package.json
pnpm add express            # Install package
pnpm add -g nodemon         # Install globally
pnpm update                 # Update packages
pnpm script-name            # Run script

# All support similar workflows
# package.json scripts work the same

list.text: Platform as a Service - Heroku, Railway, Render
Docker Containers - AWS ECS, Google Cloud Run

box.code:
# Dockerfile
FROM node:18-alpine

WORKDIR /app

# Copy package files
COPY package*.json ./

# Install dependencies
RUN npm ci --only=production

# Copy source code
COPY . .

# Create non-root user
RUN addgroup -g 1001 -S nodejs
RUN adduser -S nextjs -u 1001

# Change ownership
RUN chown -R nextjs:nodejs /app
USER nextjs

# Expose port
EXPOSE 3000

# Start application
CMD ["node", "app.js"]

# docker-compose.yml
version: '3.8'
services:
  app:
    build: .
    ports:
      - "3000:3000"
    environment:
      - NODE_ENV=production
      - DATABASE_URL=${DATABASE_URL}
      - JWT_SECRET=${JWT_SECRET}
    depends_on:
      - mongodb
    restart: unless-stopped

  mongodb:
    image: mongo:6
    ports:
      - "27017:27017"
    environment:
      - MONGO_INITDB_ROOT_USERNAME=admin
      - MONGO_INITDB_ROOT_PASSWORD=password
    volumes:
      - mongodb_data:/data/db

volumes:
  mongodb_data:

# Build and run:
# docker-compose up -d
# docker-compose down

list.text: Handle errors properly - Use try/catch and error middleware
Implement logging - Use structured logging with Winston/Pino
Security first - Use Helmet, rate limiting, input validation
Write tests - Unit tests, integration tests, e2e tests

box.code:
# Project setup
npm init                    # Create package.json
npm install express         # Install package
npm install -D jest         # Install dev dependency

# Running applications
node app.js                 # Run JavaScript file
node --watch app.js         # Run with file watching
npm start                   # Run start script
npm run dev                 # Run development script

# Development tools
npx nodemon app.js          # Auto-restart on changes
npx jest                    # Run tests
npx eslint .                # Lint code
npx prettier --write .      # Format code

# Process management
npm list                    # List installed packages
npm update                  # Update packages
npm audit                   # Security audit
npm audit fix               # Fix vulnerabilities

# Debugging
node --inspect app.js       # Enable inspector
node --inspect-brk app.js   # Break at first line

# Package publishing
npm login                   # Login to npm
npm publish                 # Publish package
npm version patch           # Bump version

# Environment
node --version              # Check Node.js version
npm --version               # Check npm version
nvm use 18                  # Switch Node version
nvm install --lts           # Install LTS version

list.text: What's the difference between require() and import?
How does Node.js handle concurrent requests with a single thread?
How do you handle environment variables in Node.js?
What's the role of middleware in Express.js?
Node.js enables JavaScript on the server
Event-driven, non-blocking I/O for high performance
Easy integration with databases and APIs
